intro: Acritopappus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved acritopappus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are elongated and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological studies due to its limited distribution.
